node.text:
Huge tip here from Zack to get cleaner reverb! If you aren’t already doing this technique, try it!⁣
⁣
This can really help you get clearer, better sounding mixes and lets your instruments stand more more so they’re not lost in your reverb signal!⁣
⁣
Follow us for more on these topics @cosmicacademy:⁣⁣⁣
⁣
𝐅𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐨𝐰 👉 @cosmicacademy 👈⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
𝐅𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐨𝐰 👉 @cosmicacademy 👈⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣

node.text:
We see this question all the time—are third party plugins REALLY worth it? ⁣
⁣
Some third party plugins are great, they can make things more convenient, faster, and easier. But are the NECESSARY to make good music? ⁣
⁣
Let us know what you think!⁣
⁣
Follow us for more on these topics @cosmicacademy:⁣⁣⁣
⁣
𝐅𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐨𝐰 👉 @cosmicacademy 👈⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
𝐅𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐨𝐰 👉 @cosmicacademy 👈⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣

node.text:
Have you explored DYNAMIC EQ yet?⁣
⁣
This feature can be incredibly useful in certain situations, especially on really dynamic material like vocals. ⁣
⁣
Let us know if you have any great uses for dynamic EQ!⁣
⁣
Follow us for more on these topics @cosmicacademy:⁣⁣⁣

node.text:
This might be a bit controversial, but is BALANCE as an artist overrated?⁣
⁣
We’re not saying you should ignore your mental health, and never rest. Rest is important. But in order to really reach your goals, you do have to make some sacrifices!⁣
⁣
What do you think??⁣

node.text:
This one goes in the Reverb Tip “HALL OF FAME”
⁣
⁣⁣
Watch the video to fully see how to go about “syncing” your pre-delay to the BPM of your track! ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Pre-delay is the amount of time it takes until the initial onset of reverb.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
⁣⁣
What do we use it for?⁣⁣
⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Mainly to create separation between our original sound, and the reverb itself. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
If that reverb begins immediately, it can wash away some of the punch/transients/clarity of our sound. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Because pre-delay introduces a timing difference, it can quickly muddy things up if it’s not rhythmically delaying with the rest of your mix. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
It can create an odd hiccup where things sound out of time. Similar to when you first begin DJ’ing and can’t beat match 😭⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Some reverbs have this “tempo sync” feature already built in. Theres also a formula to do this “delay calculator” trick. Honestly, it’s much quicker to just bookmark this page!⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Type your BPM, and try out different values. See which seems to “gel” the reverb to your mix best!⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Works great on vocals, leads, drums, and more. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Did you learn something new today? Comment and let us know! ⁣⁣
⁣⁣

One of the most underrated mixing tools we have….⁣
⁣
VOLUME!⁣
⁣
Don’t overthink this one! Whenever you encounter a mix problem, the first place you should turn is the volume slider!⁣
⁣
Feel us on this one? LIKE this video 👍⁣

node.text:
We see a lot of questions about managers. When do you need one? Should you try to find one now?⁣
⁣
A lot of producers think a manager is going to help make them successful. But remember, the only person that can make you successful is YOU 💪⁣
⁣
Follow us for more on these topics @cosmicacademy:⁣⁣⁣

node.text:
😳 Utilize these 6 TIPS to help get your records signed/supported

Getting a record signed, or track supported in a live set / radio show by another artist, is not easy!  Just getting an emailed open is hard enough...

Take these 6 tips into consideration to help increase your odds of getting your music heard by labels and artists.

node.text:
Smash that LIKE button if you feel us here?!⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Now, more than EVER, we need to focus on little wins. ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
A lot of us are still locked in our houses, or out of work, or dealing with a tough time. ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Taking these little victories is EVERYTHING. ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Something as "small" as deciding to do some push-ups instead of laying on the couch. ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Or learning how to cook a new healthy dish instead of ordering a pizza. ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
And of course it translates into your music.⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Maybe your "big goal" was to headline Ultra... but that's not happening tomorrow. ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Make some small goals, and take little victories --- like finishing that old track you've been sitting on. ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
OR - learning something new every day by following educational accounts like ours :D ... @cosmicacademy ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Regardless - these little wins aren't just GREAT for the mind, they also DO ADD UP to large victories. ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Now, go start winning. ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Follow us @cosmicacademy for more:⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
𝐅𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐨𝐰 👉 @cosmicacademy 👈⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
𝐅𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐨𝐰 👉 @cosmicacademy 👈⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣

Huge tip here from Zack to get cleaner reverb! If you aren’t already doing this technique, try it!⁣

This can really help you get clearer, better sounding mixes and lets your instruments stand more more so they’re not lost in your reverb signal!⁣
⁣

node.text:
Two extremely useful FREE Plugins 🙌 ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Today we're checking out two MUST HAVE, MUST USE free plugins!⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Voxengo SPAN (spectrum anaylzer)⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Smartelectronix s(M)exoscope (oscilloscope)⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣
**If you have trouble installing smexoscope, there's a solution at the bottom of this post.  Scroll down to read.⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣
⁣⁣
⁣
These two sit on my master channel, and remain open 24/7.⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
SPAN allows you to see the frequencies of an individual sound, sounds, or entire song in real-time!⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
This is HUGE for checking out overall mix balance, kick and bass relationship, etc.  It can even be used to reference other tracks...see where their sounds are sitting.⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣
PRO TIP⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣
*Turn on Hi-Res mode for extremely detailed information.  Great for seeing the exact frequency (and note) that a kick or sub bass is playing.  You can also find resonant peaks in mids/highs!⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Next is s(M)exoscope which is a real-time oscilloscope.  Ever wonder what your synth waveform would look like?  This shows you!⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Or how bout seeing the relationship between your kick, and sub bass.  Is there overlap?  You can clearly see these things with s(m)exoscope.⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣
⁣
PRO TIP⁣⁣⁣
⁣
⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Use it to visualize dynamic range on midi instruments.  Use it to visualize kick and sub relationship.  Use it to find stray peaks which can be clipped!⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
***Can't get Smexoscope to install properly?  You need the 64-bit version.  Search on google and choose the result from the website "ArmandoMontanez"⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣

node.text:
CHOOSE WISELY - Not all reverbs are the same! MORE below 👇
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
🎛️ Are you trying to sound natural and recreate a "specific space" for your instrument/sound? If you want that vocal to sound like it was performed in a small club, choose the appropriate setting! If you want that instrument to sound like it's in a concert hall, choose that appropriate setting!⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
🎛️ What is the tempo of your song? Faster songs typically need shorter decay times, so the reverb doesn't wash everything out. Slower songs can get away with longer reverb times.⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
🎛️ What emotion / feel are you going for. This is extremely important for vocals. Dryer sounding spaces, with short reverb times (no more than 1s) can create a sense of intimacy. Longer reverbs can create an more emotionally charged performance!⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
🎛️ How full, or empty, is your current mix? This is important because at busy times, it can be very hard to fit a reverb into the mix without muddying it (especially long verbs). You need the actual time and space to make the reverb work!⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
🎛️ Are you maintaining separation between your sounds? This is big...not every sound needs reverb! Listen to some other mixes. Often times if there are multiple things playing at once, some might be "wet" with great depth to them. Meanwhile, the other sounds are dry and up front. This helps create space between the different instruments. ⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
🎛️ What is the rhythm of your track? If you have longer sustained notes/vocal, a longer reverb might sound better. A shorter staccato performance might benefit from a tighter reverb, with less tail. This will emphasize the staccato feel.⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
🎛️ If you like our content, give us a follow⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
👉 @cosmicacademy 👈⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣

node.text:
Try this QUICK and easy way to IMPROVE your synth skills!
⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
Reverse engineering presets is a GREAT way to learn. The more you repeat this exercise, the more comfortable you will get moving around a synth.⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
🎛️ Start with a basic preset that you enjoy. It can be a lead, bass, pluck, pad, etc. Keep it simple to start though!⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
🎛️ Follow the steps in the picture above and study what the synth is actually doing. Play your synth / midi keyboard while adjusting these parameters so you can HEAR how they affect the timbre or shape of the patch. ⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
🎛️ Once you feel like you can remember what each part of the synth is doing, try and init the patch and create it from scratch! ⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
🎛️ Eventually if you repeat this exercise enough, you'll be able to learn how to create many of the common patches and sounds you like to use in your own songs.⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
🎛️ Try and do one of these a day! It shouldn't take more than 5-minutes!⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣

node.text:
😱 IMPORTANT if you use Waves Plugins⁣
⁣
⁣
Turn the ANALOG button OFF!⁣
⁣
⁣
This is adds noise to your signal, as you can see in the video. ⁣

***This is NOT turning off the amazing color and saturation that comes from the EQ/Compressor...it’s turning only turning off the “hiss” that is typical in analog gear.
⁣
⁣
When you use more of their plugins, or even start to compress these signals, it brings the noise out even more!!!⁣
⁣
⁣
Now something that wasn’t a problem, is...and it’s a big one! ⁣
⁣
⁣
Hope this simple trick helps! ♥️⁣
⁣
⁣
🧠 Follow @COSMICACADEMY⁣
⁣
⁣

node.text:
BALANCE is 🔑 - Read more below

When producing–and mixing–your focus should be on creating SPACE for your sounds. Two main areas of focus should be: ⁣
⁣
⁣
Across the FREQUENCY SPECTRUM⁣
Across the STEREO FIELD⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣
When we talk about frequency, try and space your sounds out low to high. For example kick and normally sit down low. Above that could come some of your other instruments (leads, pads, or even a vocal) and drum sounds all the way on top (high frequency).⁣
⁣
This approach can even apply when layering one sound, or group. You might have 3 bass layers, but they should also be split across the frequency spectrum. Instead of having 3 layers all playing the exact same octave/freq space...⁣
⁣
Maybe one is low, the other is mid, and the last is high.⁣
⁣
⁣
By creating this frequency separation and space, its much easier to hear each layer and sound.⁣
⁣
⁣
⁣
The same applies for the stereo field!⁣
⁣
⁣
Think of an orchestra, or a band. Are all the musicians stacked on top of each other...front and center stage?⁣
⁣
⁣
Of course not!! They are spread out.⁣
⁣
⁣
We can approach a mix the same way. When you do have competing elements, spacing them out can often help. ⁣
⁣
⁣
Maybe one layer is in the middle, while another layer is out wide. Or one is left, while the other is right. One sounds upfront, while the other sounds quieter and in the "back."⁣
⁣
⁣
This simple thought process and approach will naturally balance your mixes.⁣
⁣
⁣
⁣
SPACE YOUR SOUNDS and make your music sounds better.⁣
⁣
⁣
⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
